meanings.definition: The quality or state of being luminous.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with a soft luminosity, making everything glow gently.
meanings.sent2: The luminosity of the fireflies in the dark night sky was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The cat's eyes sparkled with a mysterious luminosity in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a luminosity that brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The luminosity of the full moon cast a magical light over the forest.

meanings.definition: The amount of light emitted by a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: Scientists measured the luminosity of the distant star to determine its size.
meanings.sent2: The luminosity of the sun is essential for sustaining life on Earth.
meanings.sent3: The alien spaceship emitted a strange luminosity that lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent4: The luminosity of the comet was so bright that it could be seen from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The luminosity of the distant galaxy fascinated astronomers studying the universe.

meanings.definition: The brightness of a star or other light source.
meanings.sent1: The luminosity of the street lamps made the city sparkle at night.
meanings.sent2: The luminosity of the fireworks lit up the sky in a dazzling display.
meanings.sent3: The disco ball added a fun luminosity to the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The luminosity of the lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The luminosity of the neon sign attracted customers to the store.
